channel.title: C++ Server
channel.description: Do you think a C++ server would be faster or slower than a java made one? Please explain why it would or wouldn't. :P

item.title: C++ Server
item.dc:creator: @final9999 final9999
item.description:
@final9999 wrote:

Like others have stated: it depends on your implementation. In C++ you’re obligated to delete unused objects from your memory. If you’re doing it wrong it could cause memory leaks, which won’t make it faster at all. C++ is hard to learn, since it’s never shown by the environment your using if you have a memory leak or not (unless ur debugging all constructors/destructors to follow ur program flow and count if all ur created objects are destroyed). Besides working with pointers and references takes alot of excersise.

My recomondation: stick with java

Regards,

Blaze

Read full topic

item.title: C++ Server
item.dc:creator: @jummppy jummppy
item.description:
@jummppy wrote:

@Lin no I’m about to start learning C++. After I learn a decent amount Ill want to try to develop a server using c++, but needless to say I’ll need help lol. Thank you for everyone that has replied

Read full topic

item.title: C++ Server
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

A well-written C++ application (e.g.: one that makes proper use of data structures, proper use of memory management, etc) will almost invariably outperform a Java or C# application.

With that said though, C++ is generally considered more difficult to grasp than Java. And given most of the people on this website are still trying to put the square through the circle hole, I wouldn’t bother.

Read full topic
